title: [Large-Scale] Concept Map Utilization Strategy Development for Nursing Learning

context.prior_knowledge: No foundational nursing theory or clinical practice experience
context.additional_context: A learning environment for self-directed learning using digital devices, requiring visual structuring training through concept mapping.

learning_goals: Learners can use concept mapping tools to represent relationships between nursing theories as structured visual materials.
Through concept map-based learning, learners improve deep thinking and critical reasoning skills by over 40% during clinical case analysis.

Applying concept map evaluation criteria (five items: clarity, logical coherence, visual organization, etc.), learners can provide feedback on three peer learning artifacts and demonstrate analytical evaluation skills with a score of 4 or higher (out of 5) on the rubric.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
